intro: Cacalia subacuminata, commonly known as the narrow-pointed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. Cacalia subacuminata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
